page.title: 02INDUCTION OF A NEW VICAR
page.content: On Wednesday 1st May a new incumbent Rev. David Bratley, was made the vicar of the joint benefice of Fleet and Gedney. This is a new office made by joining the former benefices of Fleet and Gedney together. Over 300 people came to see the bishop of Lincon perform the ceromony. The new vicar swore oaths of allegiance to Her Majesty the Queen and to the Bishop. The Bishop was dressed mainly in yellow, had a tall hat and carried a staff. A choir came from holbeach and many other clergymen atttended to help in various ways.At one point Rev. Bratley was given the keys of two churches at the main porch. After the ceremony,which lasted over an hour, there were refreshments. It was a happy occastion and the bells were rung.
